data.title: C++ indents removed in existing c++ files
data.body:
Hello,

If I open a c++ file I have been using for some years now (in svn, but I am using a local copy) it looks fine in emacs (or "less" or "pico" etc). In atom many of the indents are removed, rendering the code very difficult to read. I have attached screenshots so you hopefully easily see the difference in display between emacs and atom.

I am using atom 1.2.4 in OS X 10.11.1

Thanks,

Mark

![screen shot 2015-12-02 at 14 36 57](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12373167/11533546/39759de0-9902-11e5-98c2-dba6be948518.png)
![screen shot 2015-12-02 at 14 38 00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12373167/11533577/5a64f42e-9902-11e5-93bf-30cb610ee73e.png)

data.title: Only add absolute paths to project
data.body:
fixes #9899 - Adding a relative path seems to do ambiguous and incorrect
things. On my system, it attempts to add `/`, on the linked issue it
seems relative to something else. This change rejects relative paths. 

We could try to resolve paths, but relative to what? If there's only one path in the project, we could try relative to that, but if there are multiple, it becomes totally ambiguous.

cc @atom/feedback

data.title: Cannot delete file or folder from tree view (atom 1.3.0-beta6)
data.body:
See subject. Answering `Move to Trash` to the delete dialog results in nothing.

Works fine in atom 1.2.4.
Also 1.3.0-beta3 == no go.

Windows 7 (zip file install)

data.title: Use existing HTTP_PROXY and HTTPS_PROXY variables
data.body:
I am using Atom on a company Windows 7-laptop that is behind a proxy when at work and unproxied when at home. I am using e.g. `git` via `MINGW64` (the bash that comes with Git for Windows) and have a little script to toggle proxy settings on and off. It basically sets `HTTP_PROXY` and `HTTPS_PROXY`, which is recognized by `git`, `bower` and `npm`.

Unfortunately `apm` doesn't seem to recongize those variables, as I get `Request for package information failed: connect ETIMEDOUT` when running `apm update` from `MINGW64` while behind corporate proxy, no matter if proxy settings are declared or not.

data.title: No response when running atom at one side of desktop (Windows)
data.body:
I have a problem with atom (version 1.2.4) on my Windows 10 laptop. In Windows we can split the view and run applications side by side using Win+LEFT or Win+RIGHT key. When we run atom at one side, even if we keep atom at front, typing keyboard won't have any response until the window is restored or maximized.

Here is the way to reproduce the problem.
1. Open atom, maximize the window, type some content.
2. Type Win+RIGHT to set atom to the right of the screen.
3. Keep atom at front, type keyboard (no response this time).
4. Maximize the window, the content will now show up.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9246654/11520250/97037998-9856-11e5-9a5f-592968ad12b4.png)

data.title: atom.project.addPath : Relative paths add super folder instead.
data.body:
### Reproduce:

Add a directory to the path using a relative path, e.g.:

```
atom.project.addPath("DirectoryName")
atom.project.addPath("./DirectoryName")
```

When using the relative paths, the final result in the project explorer window is a directory with a name consisting only of a period (e.g: '.') and the contents of the specified directory listed.
![screenshot after adding relative path - 1 of 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8364502/11519026/74aac56e-984b-11e5-9182-98afd40e24fd.png)
Closing and re-opening (Tipping) the containing directory '.', results in all files/directories that are siblings to 'DirectoryName' being added to the project explorer window.  I suspect the super folder of 'DirectoryName' is the directory is the one that is actually added to the project instead and the contents of the specified directory are temporarily/initialized in the listing.

![screenshot after closing-reopening - 2 of 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8364502/11519027/74aaf35e-984b-11e5-85a7-417a28ceaba2.png)

Compare to using absolute paths:

```
atom.project.addpath("/home/user-name/DirectoryName")
```

The project explorer window has a folder with a name of 'DirectoryName' and all files.  Closing and re-opening (Tipping) the directory leaves the files unchanged.

Atom Version: 1.2.4
System: Ubuntu 14.04.3
### Done When:

Adding relative paths behaves similarly to adding absolute paths does in the project explorer window.

data.title: window state is only saved if atom was closed correctly
data.body:
this is a pretty low impact issue

i use ubuntu with i3wm, so i typically shut down my laptop at the end of a work day from the command line. this means that atom gets force closed every day. when starting it up the next day, it opens all saved windows from the last session... that i closed correctly. this means that it will usually open a ton of files that i was editing weeks ago. this can take several minutes in particularly bad instances with multiple windows.

obviously this is partially user error, but i figure i'd throw an issue up anyways. sublime doesn't behave like this so i know it can be better.

additionally it seems as though the "Open an empty editor on start" option in the preferences is ignored. my assumption is that such an option would disable persistence... am i wrong?

Hi!

 What is the criteria to list the packages search results?

data.title: Search all does not redo search after unchecking "Exclude VCS Ignored Paths"
data.body:
**Repro Steps**
1. Ensure that _Exclude VCS Ignored Paths_ is enabled
2. Search all for a specific string
3. Disable _Exclude VCS Ignored Paths_
4. Make another search with the same string

**Expected Behavior**: A new search should be made and I should see the new results
**Actual Behavior**: The search is not done and the results stay the same

data.title: :memo: Add examples for Windows script/build parameters [ci skip]
data.body: The command line parameters for script/build command where missing examples on how they should be run. That might be usefule for people starting active contribution to the project.

data.title: Atom 1.2.4 RPM binary works under 64-bit Mageia 5
data.body:
Hi,

This isn't so much a problem, but as the current [linux.md](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/build-instructions/linux.md) and [README.md](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/README.md) files do not contain any instructions relating to Mageia I thought I should mention this. See what I did was I ran:

```
urpmi https://github.com/atom/atom/releases/download/v1.2.4/atom.x86_64.rpm
```

as root. The first time I ran this I was informed that `/usr/bin/apm` from Atom conflicted with `/usr/bin/apm` from the [apmd package](http://rpmfind.net/linux/RPM/mageia/5/x86_64/media/core/release/apmd-3.2.2-32.mga5.x86_64.html). So I uninstalled apmd and re-ran this command and I managed to successfully install Atom 1.2.4 on Mageia 5. 

Thanks for your time,
Brenton

data.title: Improve the dock right-click menu on Mac
data.body:
I use Atom on Mac 90% of my time and I really think the right click menu can be improved to make my life much easier and make the world a better place in general :D 
So this is how the current right click menu looks like when I have many windows (aka projects) open at the same time:
![atom right click](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/939602/11501061/9854cccc-9831-11e5-8082-e168fc120a48.png)

Meanwhile on Sourcetree which is another favorite I use all the day too : 
![source tree menu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/939602/11501062/98556948-9831-11e5-992f-d39a03823737.png)

and here is why I like the Sourcetree version!

1- it's WAY faster to check or switch to other open projects (including minimized windows that cmd + ` ignore)
2- the top part of the menu is even more interesting because I can easily open recently closed projects so it's much easier and safe to close projects I'm not working on right now but I may need to work on soon
3- it feels more native and Mac-ish :D

Atom 1.2.4 on Mac 10.11.1

data.title: Update Impossible
data.body:
When i am on the Update tab and click "Check for Updates", i got this message:
"Fetching outdated packages and themes failed.
Request for packege information failed: Application error"

Thanks for fixing it.
Rgds,

data.title: 'Window' menu doesn't list any windows
data.body: After opening a file or a folder in atom there are never any entries in the "Window" menu. Opening more windows doesn't add any entries either. I see this in 1.2.4 on Mac OS 10.11.1

data.title: Why  choose 'atom' as the name of editor
I hope to release the green version (not installation，unzip).
data.body: I hope to release the green version (not installation，unzip).

data.title: Want to add text 2/3 sublime, the right side of the preview of the scroll bar
data.body: Want to add text 2/3 sublime, the right side of the preview of the scroll bar

data.title: Files in `.gitignore` are not in tree view
data.body: Previously these files were just greyed out - this was actually very helpful. Typically the only reason I have a file in `.gitignore` is when I have a file that has things like keys that I don't want to push to the repo but that I still need to touch from time to time. Not being able to see these files _at all_ is hugely inconvenient and was a huge surprise :(

data.title: Syntax highlighting on array stops after 47 items on single line
data.body:
I have an array with many numbers on a single line, after 47 numbers the syntax highlighting stops.

![47ids](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/738975/11488803/25af123e-982e-11e5-9cd7-0d629eb07338.PNG) 

After the end of the array, normal syntax colouring continues as expected. 

Atom v1.2.4 - Windows 7 x64

Theme is `Monokai For One Dark`, but the issue appears on the default Atom themes as well.
